intro: Lessertia sulcata, commonly known as the African violet, is a popular ornamental plant native to tropical Africa. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil. It is known for its ability to thrive in humid environments and is often cultivated as a houseplant. The flowers, which are usually violet or purple in color, bloom throughout the year under optimal conditions.
